title: [SCHEDULE] Add group, refactor thread bind api.
body:
- Add schedule.create_group to group stages with constraints
   - group_stage.compute_at moves the entire group around
- Refactor thread binding interface
   - Instead if put thread axis in the scheduling tree, we create new IterVar and bind them to thread via stage.bind
   - This solves the problem when one thread index appears in multiple locations in the same schedule

title: [LANG/SCHEDULE] Reduction factor, predicate in reduction.
body:
Support rfactor that factors reduction into temporal stage and then reduction.

```python
n = tvm.convert(1027)
A = tvm.placeholder((n,), name='A')
k = tvm.reduce_axis((0, n))
B = tvm.compute((1,), lambda i: tvm.sum(A[k], axis=k, where=(i>1)), name='B')
kf = tvm.reduce_axis((0, 4))
# schedule
s = tvm.Schedule(B.op)
_, ki = s[B].split(k, outer=kf)
BF = s.rfactor(B, kf)
s[BF].parallel(BF.op.axis[0])
```

The original reduction is ```B = sum(A, axis=1)```. rfactor changes it two two stage reduction

```python
BF = sum(A.pad_reshape(4,  n/4), axis=1)
B = sum(B, axis=0)
```
pad_reshape will include predicate to guard that the index won't exceed bound. This allows further manipulation of BF's first factored axis, for example parallelize over the factored dimension

title: [VERILOG] Generalize Buffer and Tests
body:
Added the TVM buffering unit, along with 3 testbenches that exercise the buffer as (1) a fifo, (2) a line buffer and (3) a double buffer.

The read logic is left in the verilog testbench. This leaves the python testbench to take care of test data writes, and correctness logic.

A special signal, read_data_valid, indicates that the data coming back from a read request is valid, and therefore can be checked against reference data.

title: [CODEGEN] Refactor common codegen, Verilog Codegen
body:
This PR contains changes in quite a few places

### Codegen Flow

IR -> SplitPipeline -> pipeline annotated IR -> verilog::MakePipeline -> verilog low level ir -> CodeGenVerilog -> verilog code -> runtime

Related codes:

- Pipeline Annotated IR
   - [src/pass/split_pipeline.cc](https://github.com/tqchen/tvm/blob/tqchen/src/pass/split_pipeline.cc)
- Verilog Low Level IR
   - [src/codegen/verilog/verilog_ir.h](https://github.com/tqchen/tvm/blob/tqchen/src/codegen/verilog/verilog_ir.h)
  - Low level IR contains compute blocks that are connected by channels(which can be buffer, RAM, FIFO)
  - It also contains loop structure, and trigger signals(which triggers buffer advance and done)

### Codegen Workflow
Each codegen of compute block will generate the data path, the loop structure.  
- Synchronization logic is done by checking valid signal from all input and send back the ready in the current cycle.
   - This is inefficient as per discussed with @tmoreau89 . To solve this problem we can add cache registers in the inputs, which makes the control signal smaller.
- All the trigger signal, data, valid is delayed by the ***same amount of cycles***, before feed into write buffer
   - There is currently no delay model of expression, ideally we should have a pass on expressions to get the estimated delay, this can be done in a followup PR.
- Indexed load are splitted into a separate stage, so C[i] = A[i]+1 contains two stages, the first stage loads A[i] and put it into a FIFO, the second stage load the data from FIFO, plus 1 and store to C
    - Currently FIFO is implemented with cached register
- Stall signal is derived from ready signal of the write buffer, when it stalls, it stalls the delayed registers.
- The signal ports of channels are directly put into a map, and channels are generated later
- The channels are generated by instantiate modules with connections specified in the port map.

When a function is invoked, a main function will be generated to hookup the compiled modules as well as simulated RAM.
- The load/write into RAM currently is cheated by using a vpi_mmap.

### Runtime Simulator Hook
 When a code is generated, it is hooked by https://github.com/tqchen/tvm/blob/tqchen/python/tvm/addon/verilog.py#L263  which set the arguments into registers and start reset signal

title: [CODEGEN/LLVM] Initial support for codegen LLVM.
body:
***Finished Item***
- Pass basic checks in tests/python/unittests/test_codegen_stack_llvm.py
- JIT is supported.
- Requires LLVM version >= 4.0
- Rework the RTTI system in HalideIR so now tvm is indpendent from rtti as in llvm
   - Because LLVM compiles with fno-rtti, we need to follow this in order to be able to link with LLVM most people have

***To Support***
- Vectorized load
- NVPTX for ptx generation.
- Mix LLVM pipeline with other codegens
- Parallel loop

title: [LANG] Introduce Scan, bugfix Canonical
body:
## Introduce the scan operator
The following code compute the cumsum of X
```python
def my_cumsum():
   m = tvm.Var("m")
    n = tvm.Var("n")
    t = tvm.IterVar((1, m), name="t")
    X = tvm.placeholder((m, n), name="X")
    s_state = tvm.placeholder((m, n))
    s_init = tvm.compute((1, n), lambda _, i: X[0, i])
    s_update = tvm.compute((n,), lambda i: s_state[t-1, i] + X[t, i])
    res = tvm.scan(t, s_init, s_update, s_state)
```

### Known Limitations to be Improved
- There is no checking yet on the scan reference to state, should always ensure only refer to previous timestamp
- Do not yet allow subslice result of scan, need to add fix point detection to allow subslice axis that are simple(only refers to itself during recursion)

## Bug Fix in Canonical
Previously did not multiple constant by -1 during sub, making ```m-1``` to ```m+1```, added a regression test.

title: [SCHEDULE] Refactor bound inference logic
body:
The new inference logic uses a relax approach, to relax the bound of direct consumers.
- This avoids the bound prop by indirect dependencies
- This ensures there is no OOB error when reading from the internal estimated buffer

title: [API/Refactor] Unified PackedFunc for API and Generated Functions
body:
- PackedFunc class is now formalized, with a full fledge capabilities of type-erased calls
    - This enables bi-directional exchange of python/c++ functions easy
- It also enhances PackedFunc to be able handle return values
- Removes the original APIFunction mechanism, API function is now simply globally registered PackedFunc

title: [API/JIT] Enable registrable global function, introduce StackVM
body:
- Allow registering/converting python function into PackedFunc
   - This enables us to use python function as callbacks (fun debugging) in the target program
-  Introduce StackVM, which is a simple stack-based vm to interpret host side procedures when JIT for host side is not available.
